dialogue.text: To watch them be restored.
Hear ye, hear ye!
In light of recent developments made to both the protagonist of our video game and the world he inhabits, we, the Plant Council, have reconvened for our 98th meeting.
The topic of today’s discussion will be the significance of S-
Okay, first off, what else could {i}you{/i} possibly be doing tonight?
Your mother. Ayooo.
Thank you. Now, to get back to what I was about to say, there is an entire {i}truckload{/i} of contradictory evidence supporting-
It was her NAME PLATE, bro! Come on!
It’s on the grave and everything!
But that doesn’t explain the several {i}other{/i} instances where-
Oh God, here we go again. Or is it {i}god?{/i} I never know which capitalization I’m supposed to use in this game as it fluctuates more than Ami’s personality. Somebody gimme five.
We are plants. We can not high five.
That really is one of the worst parts of not being a human.
Speaking of humans, I’d like to welcome tonight’s very special guest — Yomiel, who has come face to face with Sensei on several occasions now.
Sup, Yomiel.
That human looks a lot like a rabbit to me.
{i}Perception,{/i} bro. Go replay Down the Rabbit Hole and get back to me. There’s a whole thing about it.
But then why wasn’t the event called Down the Human Hole?
No way. I saw what happened to his wife and saplings after he got zapped. I can’t do that to Bethany.
Bethany? The one from the phone sex line?
It is a “compassion” hotline. We do other things too.
Yomiel, your last appearance was several updates ago, but it is my understanding that both you and your brethren are present more than you are actually seen. Is this true?
That would be correct. My family and I have been placed all over this world to both learn and observe. So even if you can not see us, you can assume we are there.

Like many other things, it is all a matter of perception. And it is quite possible that today, on the second holiest night of the year, that all of {i}you{/i} will see things that are not actually there either.

And what is it that makes {i}tonight{/i} the second holiest night of the year when it is widely agreed upon that the true birthday of Jesus Christ is not on December 25th, but sometime in the middle of the year?
See, that’s the thing, though. The relevancy of Jesus Christ in the landscape of this world is not as strong as it is in others.
We have different gods here. Ones that are a lot more complicated and finicky than some brown dude who wandered the desert, gently fellating his apostles before licking their feet.
Speaking of brown people, I’d like to lick Imani’s feet if you know what I’m saying.
Imani is {i}black.{/i} Tsuneyo is the brown one.
That’s actually a hotly contested topic but, let’s be real, I’d lick both of them.
Amen.
Please don’t say “amen” in front of Yomiel. It is religiously insensitive.
It’s fine. I’ve been falling out of favor with my designated god lately anyway and have been thinking of migrating closer to the center.
Could you elaborate on that? What makes the position of the other gods any different from yours?
It really comes down to subtlety at the end of the day.
It just rubs me the wrong way hearing, “TAKE SOMETHING THAT ISN’T YOURS” instead of just silently taking things without really making a big show out of it.
I see the appeal in both sides. Which is precisely why I was so excited to come here and talk to {i}you{/i} guys about it since I know you’re all unbiased.
Ahh, fuck. Sorry guys.
Or is it {i}we{/i} who are upside down?
I see what you did there.
Finally, some background info. Only had to wait three fucking years.
Hey, we’ve got some bits and pieces in the past. Like the part about her being a popular poet. Or the part about how she wanted to bone kids.
Oh, speaking of that, did you see that thing in the Discord where Selebus said one of the main girls is a shotacon? Which one do you think it is?
I think I’m leaning toward Nodoka.
Nodoka would fuck anything. She doesn’t count.
{i}Ahem.{/i}
Sorry, boss. Please proceed.
So, we all know that Sekai-
SIL.
Hah...we all know that {i}Ami’s mother{/i}-
If it {i}is{/i} her mother.
This fucking guy.
...we all know that the red-haired woman from Sensei’s past can’t remain hidden forever. And the nature of this sudden vacation so far has made it seem like she may be closer than we believe.
Yomiel, as a current (yet wavering) member of the Church of New Hope, is there anything you can tell us about the woman who may or may not be named Sekai?
No.
Nothing at all?
Nope.
I told you we should have gotten Wormwood. Nobody remembers this guy. He’s a dreg.
Hey, I didn’t have to come here. There’s a big party in the forest tonight and sometimes Yasu forgets that we have vision and spreads her legs in a way that lets us see up her skirt.
Don’t stick your dick in crazy, man.
Always stick your dick in crazy, man. I’m rooting for you.
Unfortunately, I am a being without genitalia and thus can not participate in coital activities. But that doesn’t stop the fantasies.
Well, seeing as Yomiel has nothing to say on tonight’s topic, I guess there’s not much left for us to go off of.
Looks like we’ll have to just keep wondering when the next dreaded SIL appearance is going to be.
Yeah, because there’s {i}no way{/i} Sekai’s going to show up tonight or anything.
Is she?
Oh no...
Bro, what do you think the narrator was talking about when they mentioned something being {i}restored?{/i}
Dude, I don’t know. It’s impossible to know what the narrator is talking about literally ever. Or who that narrator even {i}is{/i} since there are, like...a bunch of them.
Well, I guess we’ll have to just wait and see.
We need to leave.
What?
We need to leave right now.
Um...
She is {i}coming.{/i}
Covered in char-broiled lizards, I watch as the funny plants do a funny dance and put an end to their funny show.
I wasn’t able to hear anything they were saying this time as my ability to converse with those who are not human normally only applies to animals.
The lizards move as somewhere beneath their crispy skin, they can still think and feel. But the batter is far too thick and too delicious for their cordless vocal muscles to penetrate.
I hear nothing. Not even the sound of the squares behind me.
I wonder how long it’s been?
I wonder how long the show has gone on for?
I wonder when the upside down trees will kiss the rightside up grass and rejoin to form a ground worth walking on?
I wonder when anyone will come to understand my metaphors?
There is only one person who ever could.
But she is gone now.
And she’s never coming back.
How can you be so sure of that in a world where nothing is permanent?
If the world itself is made for you, what’s stopping it from making {i}me?{/i}
She’s gone and she’s never coming back.
Only if you give up.
You’re not a {i}quitter,{/i} are you?
After all we’ve been through, you want to just leave me on my own?
What did I do to deserve that?
I loved you, you know? And you can deny it all you want, but you loved me too.
You {i}still{/i} love me.
You emit a certain scent when you’re aroused. It’s my favorite scent in the world.
Go on.
Show me how {i}big{/i} it’s gotten.
Hurt me more than I can hurt myself.
{b}SHE IS GONE AND SHE IS NEVER COMING BACK.{/b}
Do you think I’m a bad person? That I ever wanted to hurt you?
Because it was {i}you{/i} I loved the most until {i}she{/i} came.
Why can’t I be with you two?
It’s cold beneath the surface. I want to feel your warmth.
I want those long arms wrapped around me.
I want my flesh stuck to yours. I want our sweat on the bedsheets and your tears on my tongue.
Taste me and make me yours a millionth time.
Come! Take it!
Doesn’t it feel nostalgic being in a place like this?
Where no one can see us for miles and miles and miles...
Think of everything we can do.
How quiet it all is.
A place where no one can judge us.
Where we are free to be ourselves.
Where there’s no pain or consequence or {i}anything.{/i}
It’s just us.
It’s what we’ve always wanted.
A place where we can be ourselves.
We can laugh and smile and fuck and sing and waste away our days beneath our favorite trees!
This is the life that we were made for. Not the one {i}out there.{/i}
Bring me back.
{b}{s}SHE IS NEVER COMING BACK.{/s} I CAN’T BREATHE IN HERE.{/b}
Hey.
How about we play a game?
It’s one we played when you were little.
One your mother used to play with you.
The way you’d smile every time you saw me...it always made my heart skip a beat.
I wonder when it was that it started skipping more than one at once?
いない。。。いない。。。
ばあ！
Stop.
いない。。。いない。。。
ばああああ！
STOP.
いない。。。いない。。。
{size=+40}{b}STOP PLAYING WITH ME{/b}{/size}
ばあ！
Ah...
Hm...
It’s like you haven’t grown a day.
Sensei. Wake up.
Good morning, sleepyhead. Would you mind explaining why you’re passed out a full three miles away from the inn?
Makoto?...Futaba?...What’s going on?
We were going for a walk and noticed someone sleeping up here, so we wanted to go make sure they were okay, but...we didn’t think it’d be you.
What happened? It’s not like you to willingly walk away from a room full of teenage girls.
I think I was...looking for Yumi or...right- Futaba, Rin wants you to know she’s sorry and that you should come back to the inn.
I know...I already talked to her.
When? How long have I been asleep?
Well, we have no idea when you went out, but it’s about 1:00 AM right now.
Then what are {i}you two{/i} doing three miles away from the inn? You should be asleep.
Wait, let me guess. You’re heading the search party for me.
No, actually. Nobody went out to look for you. In fact, nobody even remembers you exist except for Futaba and me.
It’s true. They all seem to believe that Imani has been their teacher all year. And Ami won’t stop bragging about how fun it is to live alone.
Okay. I was concerned for half a second, but now I know that you’re fucking with me.
Do you need help getting up? Can you stand?
I angle myself upward and dust a mixture of sand and dirt off of my blazer before crossing my legs and thanking the two of them for waking me up.
I...have no idea how I made it all the way over here or...why my head suddenly hurts so much...
But I’m glad that I was discovered before dawn since I doubt anyone would believe literally any explanation I would have come up with for this.
It’s a good thing we found you when we did. Because there’s no way anyone would have believed literally any explanation you would have come up with for this.
Yes, Makoto. I am well aware.
Even I’m having a hard time believing it and I’m here.
It’s one thing to wander off and do your own thing, but...we’re a long way from the inn.
He must have come to get away from everyone. That’s why we’re here, after all.
Mutual hatred for snoring? Who is the culprit?
It’s nothing like that.

What is it then? What common ground do the two of you share that was strong enough to force you three miles down the beach in the middle of the night? Because if it’s something as boring as reading, I-
We were having a long, serious discussion about how crazy it is that you’ve been having sex with {i}both{/i} of us. Isn’t that fun?
Makoto...
What? I want to see what he has to say about it.
Well, at least I understand why you came all the way over here to talk about that. Not really a great topic to get caught discussing.
We’re not doing it for our safety, we’re doing it for yours.
We’ve both known...there are “others” for a long time. But it wasn’t until Halloween that we figured out {i}each other{/i} were among those people.
Ever since then, we’ve been talking more and airing out our grievances about how fruitless the pursuit of your heart is and how, even knowing that, we can’t keep ourselves away.
It’s actually rather pathetic, but...it is what it is.
I’m not really sure what I’m supposed to say during a time like this. Normally, when I’m confronted, it’s by one person- not two.
How calming it is knowing that this is a regular thing for you.
I didn’t mean it like that.
Then...how did you mean it, Sensei? Because it seems like Makoto and I believed we were fulfilling the same role as one another in your life and-
You two don’t have specific {i}roles.{/i} You’re attractive girls who like me that I can have sex with whenever I want. Of course I’m going to take advantage of that.
You really do have a way with words, Sensei.
That...That’s not {i}all{/i} we are, though...is it?

There’s obviously more to it than that. But if you’re going to be blunt enough to confront me about this directly, I’m going to be respectful enough to tell it like it is instead of beating around the bush.
This...isn’t really how I expected this conversation would go...
This is {i}exactly{/i} how I expected this conversation would go.

Listen, I care about both of you...in ways that transcend the time we spend behind closed doors. But I don’t have some end-all, be-all excuse or explanation for why things are the way they are. They just {i}are.{/i}
If that makes you want to stop what we’re doing, fine. I don’t blame you. I know that nothing good can last forever.
But I also know there’s never been a point in either one of the relationships I’ve had with you two where some brand of exclusivity was guaranteed or even {i}expected.{/i} Am I right?
Yeah...of course I’m-
And don’t “Of course I’m not enough” me when your self-confidence is finally starting to take a turn in the right direction.
I’ve just accepted that-
Don’t you go self-deprecating either, Makoto.
I get that you’re going through a tough time, but if you keep blaming your shitty mental state on the same one thing for the rest of your life, you’re going to wind up like me.
How did this turn into {i}us{/i} being lectured?
Because Sensei’s a master manipulator and finds it easier to just make things about {i}other{/i} people instead of ever trying to fix the parts of {i}himself{/i} that are broken.
Why does anything need fixing in the first place?
Why can’t we just accept that things don’t need to be in perfect shape in order for us to use them on a daily basis?
You’re sleeping with us...{i}because{/i} we’re imperfect?
That is definitely not what I was going for, but...sure.
Futaba, I told you a long time ago that I’d never be able to accept your feelings until you started thinking better of yourself.
And Makoto, I’ve made {i}several{/i} pledges to treat you better after directly acknowledging just how much I’ve taken advantage of you.
Right, and...when is that going to start, exactly? Because things don’t seem very different right now, Sensei.
They {i}are{/i} though.
I hide from everything. It’s what I do. But I’m owning up and trying to explain myself right now.

My apologies if my explanation isn’t {i}perfect{/i} but it’s kind of hard to justify my stance as an adult male simultaneously screwing two high school girls who are supposed to be able to depend on me.
That’s just the thing, though. We {i}do{/i} still depend on you. That’s why we’re finding solace in one another instead of spilling your secrets out to the entire class.
Makoto’s right. We trust you, Sensei. Just...not when it comes to...monogamous relationships.

It’s quite possible that’s one more side effect of your manipulation tactics and that we’re simply just too codependent at this point to function {i}without{/i} a change in the details of our relationship...
But I digress.
That didn’t sound like much of a digression to me.
I think...what Makoto is trying to say is that...it’s okay. We’re not mad.
We’re just a little...confused because we want to understand you better.
That’s not entirely true. I’m mad. But growing up in a household where probably over one hundred people have had sex has made me rather jaded and I am now monogamy’s biggest fan. Sorry, Mom.
But...you do want to understand Sensei a little more, right?
That part is right, yes.
But why?
I strung you along...used you for my own benefit...lied to you...manipulated you...
I did everything wrong...
You’re not supposed to like me. It’s supposed to be the other way around...
Is that what you want? To be abhorred? To be condemned?
I...I obviously don’t like the...idea of sharing you, but...but if that’s the price I have to pay for the way you make me feel...I can handle that.
I’m not sure if I can. But at this point, who the fuck even cares? I’ve already been through the worst. I’m pretty sure I can handle whatever comes next.
I don’t get it...
I don’t get any of you.
Why do you keep coming back to me?
Why did you wake me up?
Because you woke {i}us{/i} up...and it’s only fair if we do the same for you.
Just go back to sleep...
I escape the firm, wet grasp of evil hands and return to the inn with two girls by my side.
They escape something else.
No one hears or sees us come in.
And I sleep facing down in a bed that smells of cherry blossoms.
I don’t deserve their love.
{b}DAY END.{/b}
